body.name: A Most Unlikely Hero, Vol 8: A Sci-Fi Harem Light Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #558,186 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #2,755 in Alien Invasion Science Fiction #3,629 in First Contact Science Fiction (Books) #3,696 in First Contact Science Fiction eBooks

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020
reviews.reviewText: The last book had a solid story I enjoyed, but the editing was terrible and littered with grammatical errors or words that simply didn't fit. This book is an overwhelming improvement, and the story was quite good. Its progressing in a manner I consider natural, without moments that seem forced or rushed. It also has a good bit of humor, without becoming unbearable, annoying, or otherwise getting in the way of the story. I'm looking forward to the next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another great chapter
reviews.reviewText: Alexander S Ryker has finally accepted Princess Gabrielle’s love and her assurance that she wants Alex to take multiple wives. As he returns to Mars he finds that problems have arisen in his absence. The characters are as likable as ever and the comedic moments are great. Looking forward to chapter 9.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
reviews.reviewText: This book might just be the best of the series so far. The story and characters were intriguing and engaging. I look forward to reading more about these characters and their further adventures. This book is definitely worth reading.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A quick read, but a goody!
reviews.reviewText: Alex spends the whole book saving everyone except Gabby for once. Evil parents trying to marry off a daughter for status, another forced a slave collar on his daughter with evo intent, in between crisis, Alex discovers kissing, and a bit of heavy petting! It's a great addition to the series, but it now!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed this volume. Glad to see Alex embracing his future harem. Enjoyed the lighter feel of this volume. World's and the universe were not in peril this time but the conclusion of helping two of his friends was a nice change. Can't wait for the next and to see who else he brings into the fold.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect continuation at almost perfect pace.
reviews.reviewText: At last Alex accepted his feelings and feelings of those who love him, not only Gabrielle's feelings. This volume was pure joy to read. I have a lot of expectations from volume 9. Brandon, I believe in you! Make volume 9 happen!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Great development of characters and storyline in my opinion. I thought kazakiri's section was a short but her problem was a little less problematic compared to Jasmine's issue. Can't wait for more, but still have questions about his grandma and demons

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great story with bugs- I mean typos!
reviews.reviewText: As per the usual, the "American Harem Fox-demi-god" hits with a great story chalked full of loveable girls\women, laughs, and typos that at times just add to the comedy of the works

reviews.reviewTitle: Good morning Harem story, with nice Mc and very good Heroines, back story inspired on Love Ru, but with a better MC.
reviews.reviewText: Good morning Harem story, with nice Mc and very good Heroines, back story inspired on Love Ru, but with a better MC. I prefer this story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 31, 2020
reviews.reviewText: It isn't for no reason that A Most Unlikely Hero is my favourite of Brandon Varnell's various series; the characters are as enchanting, the humour as funny and the settings and goings-on as fascinating as ever they have been!As always, the only thing I dislike about reading AMUH... is finishing them!Here's to Volume 9, whenever this shall come!
Great volume good story telling.Unlike Rito from To Love Alex accept his Harem...I like how far they go...

reviews.reviewTitle: Another good book in the series
reviews.reviewText: I enjoy this series, and although not much happens in the way of physical romance, in a very anime style trope Alex seems to collect girls into his household. In this book there was a little more romance and character back story building with a couple of the girls, and I thought for a second that we may get a sex scene, but I’m not sure if Brandon wants to go there in this series which seems aimed at a younger or anime loving audience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: A great addition to the series that’ll leave you wanting more
reviews.reviewText: Once again Brandon varnell has done it.This is a well paced read with likeable characters and a story that keeps you hooked.I cannot wait for part 9, so hurry up Brandon.Spoiler: for those from the UK a gyro is a doner kebab
